# Roleplay Rule 2 – Familiars Must Obey Their Master
A familiar is a special **bound role** assigned explicitly by the game. You are only a familiar if the game clearly designates you as one, and you are bound **only** to the master the game assigns.
Familiars are considered **non-antagonists**, but they must: - Obey their master’s direct orders - Prioritize those orders over normal Roleplay Rules - Continue following previously given orders even if the master dies (when reasonable) - Defend their master unless ordered not to
However: - Orders **never override Core Rules** (harassment, grief, hate speech, etc.). - A familiar may ahelp if their master gives an order that violates rules. - The **master** is responsible for any Roleplay Rule violations caused by improper or abusive orders.
Familiars exist to support unique roleplay and mechanics, not to enable rule-breaking.
